info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 11:31AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...
Big Muddy River near Murphysboro affecting Jackson County.
Big Muddy River near Plumfield affecting Franklin and Williamson Counties.
.Very heavy rainfall ranging from 6 to 9 inches fell across the Big Muddy River basin over the past week. This will keep river levels elevated over at least the next week. Major flooding is forecast to develop at Murphysboro this week with moderate flooding at Plumfield. Crests are expected on Wednesday at both locations.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Big Muddy River near Murphysboro.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 36.0 feet, Damage begins to property near Shoemaker Drive in Murphysboro. Evacuations may be needed to parts of a mobile home park.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 32.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 36.5 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
